li.p: determining whether any impairment loss exists at the date of transition to IFRSs; and

measuring any impairment loss that exists at that date, and reversing any impairment loss that no longer exists at that date. An entity’s first IFRS financial statements include the disclosures that IAS 36 would have required if the entity had recognised those impairment losses or reversals in the period beginning with the date of transition to IFRSs (paragraph 24(c) of the IFRS).
